attributes.action: resign from office over the child benefit data loss fiasco
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
the current prime minister, gordon brown, who was chancellor when hm customs merged with the inland revenue department, was the instigater of the cost cutting exercise which has resulted in the fiasco of a cd with 10-15million families data being lost and putting these families christmas at risk due to possible fraud. 
his response in the commons pmq was to laugh it off. i guess his data wasn't on the said cd is he going to write to each individual whose data is on the said cd, to guarentee the cost incurred if any in time and energy spent in changing all bank accounts, standing orders , direct debits etc. Also what of the future of all the children named on this said cd.
a farce beyond belief resignation is the only honourable option.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
